meanings.definition: Settle or lie comfortably within or against something.
meanings.sent1: The kitten will nestle in the soft blanket.
meanings.sent2: The baby bird will nestle in its cozy nest.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy puppy decided to nestle in the warm laundry.
meanings.sent4: The old book seemed to nestle comfortably on the dusty shelf.
meanings.sent5: The child's favorite teddy bear would always nestle close at bedtime.

meanings.definition: Be in a cozy or snug position.
meanings.sent1: The squirrel will nestle in the hollow of the tree.
meanings.sent2: The baby will nestle in the soft blankets for a nap.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to nestle in the sunbeam by the window.
meanings.sent4: The warm cup of tea will nestle in her hands on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The cozy sweater will nestle warmly around her shoulders.

meanings.definition: Be located in a sheltered or protected place.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit will nestle in the burrow to stay safe.
meanings.sent2: The eggs will nestle in the nest until they hatch.
meanings.sent3: The boat will nestle in the calm harbor during the storm.
meanings.sent4: The small village will nestle in the valley surrounded by mountains.
meanings.sent5: The secret garden will nestle behind the tall hedge for privacy.
